gurmukhi: gopI suin pwXo ieh Taur blB`dR AwXo sXwm AwXo hÍYhY mwNg syNDr Brq hY ]bysr ibMdUAw qn BUKn bnwie kib sXwm cwr locnn AMjn Drq hY ]
transliteration: Gopisoun(i) Paayo Eh Thaur Balbhaddra Aayo Syaam Aayo Hvaihai Maan Sendhar Bharat Hai|| Besar Bindooaa|| Tan Bhookhan Banaae Kabi Syaam Chaar Lochnan Anjan Dharat Hai||
translation: When the Gopis came to know that Balram has come, they thought that Krishna also might have come and thinking this, they filled their parting of hair with saffron; they put the frontal mark on their foreheads and wore ornaments and used collyrium in their

gurmukhi: dwmnI sI dmk idKwie inj kwie bUJY mwq BRwq kI n SMkw ko krq hY ]dIjY Gn sXwm kI bqwie su`D hwie hmY sXwm bilrwm hwhw pwien prq hY ]2254]
transliteration: Daamnisidamak Dikhaae Nij Kaae Boodheai Maat Bhraat Kina Shankaa Ko Kart Hai|| Deejai Ghan Syaam Kibataae Suddh Haae Hamai Syaam Bal(i)raam Haahaa Parat Hai||2254||
translation: They flashed like lightning and forsaking the shyness of their parents and brothers, they fell at the feet of Balram saying, “O Balram! we fall at your feet; tell us something about Krishna.”2254.

gurmukhi: hlI kIXo snmwn sB guAwrn ko iqh smY ]hau kirhau su bKwn ijau kQ Awgy hoie hY ]2255]
transliteration: Halikeeyo Sanmaan Sabh Guaaran Ko Tih Samai|| Hau Karihau Su Bakhaan Jio Kath Aage Hoe Hai||2255||
translation: Balram gave due respect to all gopis and I relate the story that advanced further;2255.

gurmukhi: eyk smY muslIDr qwhI mY AwnMd so iek Kylu mcwXo ]XwhI ky pIvn ko mdrw ihq sXwm jlwiDp dY kY pTwXo ]
transliteration: Ek Samai Mousleedhar Taahimai Aanand So Ik Khel(u) Machadyo|| Yaahike Peevan Ko Madraa Hit Syaam Jalaadhip Dai Kai Pathaayo||
translation: Once Balram performed a play; Varuna sent wine for his drinking,

gurmukhi: pIvq BXo qb so muslI midm`iq BXo mn mY suK pwXo ]nIr cihXO jmnw kIXo mwn su AYNc leI hil isau kib gwXo ]2256]
transliteration: Peevat Bhyo Tab So Mouslimad(i)matt(i) Bhayo Man Mai Soukh Paayo|| Neer Chahiyau Jamnaa Keeyo Maan Su Ainch Laihal(i) Sio Kab(i) Gadyo||2256||
translation: Drinking with which he became intoxicated; Yamuna showed some pride before him, he drew the waters of Yamuna, with his plough.2256
Speech of Yamuna addressed to Balram:

gurmukhi: lyhu hlI qum nIru ibnu dIjY nh doS duK ]sunhu bwq rnDIr hau cyrI jdurwie kI ]2257]
transliteration: Lehu Halitoum Neer(u) Bin(u) Deejai Nah Dosh Doukh|| Sounoh Baat Randheer Hau Cherijaduraae Kee||2257||
translation: “O Balram ! take the water, I see no fault or suffering in doing so; but O conqueror of the battlefield! you listen to me, I am only the maid-servant of Krishna.”2257.

gurmukhi: duie hI su mws rhy iqh TwN iPr lyn ibdw cl nMd pY Awey ]Pyr gey jsuDw hU ky mMdr qw pg pY ieh mwQ Cuhwey ]
transliteration: Due Hisu Maas Rahe Tih Thaan Phir Len Bidaa Chal Nand Pai Aae|| Pher Gad Jasudhaa Hoo Ke Mandar Taa Pag Pai Eh Maath Chhudaae||
translation: Balram stayed there for two months and the went to the abode of Nand and Yashoda; he put his head on their feet for bidding farewell,
